title: Rugby World Cup 2019 rankings - part three: Sir Ian McGeechan's verdict on which quarter-finalists have the most lethal half-back combinations
text:
Throughout the week, Telegraph Sport's expert columnists will be ranking the quarter-finalists by positions. The third installment sees Sir Ian McGeechan deliver his verdict on which teams have the best and worst half-backs.

This is in order of importance to the teams' success, how the players in these positions can influence games during the knockout stages of the tournament.

8. France (Maxime Machenaud and Camille Lopez)

I’ve got France bottom of my list purely because I don’t know who they will start with - and I don’t think they do either, especially since news broke of Antoine Dupont's potential injury. There is no logic or consistency to French selection. I think this probably represents...
description: Throughout the week, Telegraph Sport's expert columnists will be ranking the quarter-finalists by positions.
